newsitem.title: USA: PaineWebber up on takeover talk - analysts.
newsitem.headline: PaineWebber up on takeover talk - analysts.

text.p: Shares in PaineWebber Group Inc rose on Friday amid market talk that Morgan Stanley Group Inc might make a bid for PaineWebber, analysts said.
But Morgan Stanley denied the market speculation.
"We are not in talks to acquire PaineWebber," a Morgan Stanley spokeswoman said.
A PaineWebber spokesman denied comment, citing corporate policty not to comment on the price of the company's stock, or on rumors or speculation.

Donaldson, Lufkin and Jenrette brokerage industry analyst Joan Solotar said Morgan Stanley's flat denial of the market rumors, rather than the standard "no comment," is an indication it is truely not interested in acquiring PaineWebber.
"It's not to say (PaineWebber) is not a takeover candidate, but I don't think it's Morgan," Solotar said.

Earlier this month PaineWebber's shares rose sharply after a Business Week article said the New York-based brokerage was being eyed as a takeover target by BankAmerica Corp and others. Both PaineWebber and BankAmerica declined comment at the time.
